item.title: New York Times Strands Hints and Answers for July 9, 2024
item.description:
Strands is back with another difficult puzzle from the New York Times Games. If you are stuck on this challenging puzzle, you aren't alone. Today's puzzle is one of the more challenging ones that the NYT has come up with.

If you already know how to play Strands , and you are stuck on today's puzzle, this article can help. In here, you can find general hints, spoilers, an explanation for the puzzle, and even the full answer if you would like to see it for yourself.

The NYT Games Strands Puzzle #128 for July 9, 2024

The Strands puzzle for today has the clue Now on Exhibit . It has six things to find, including one Spangram and five themed words.

New York Times Games Strands Clues

If you don't like the in-game hints in this free-to-play PC game because it spoils whole words, you will want to check out the sections below. There are three spoiler-free hints that will get you closer to the theme today.

General Hint 1

General Hint 2

General Hint 3

Spoilers for Two of the Words in Today's Strands

If a spoiled word or two would be helpful for this New York Times Games puzzle game, you can find two words in the sections below. Open them up to see the full word as well as its position inside the puzzle.

Spoiler 1

Spoiler 2

The Answer to Today's New York Times Games Strands

The full answer to today's Strands puzzle is in the section below. It contains the category Spangram, the themed words, and their positions in the puzzle as well.

Today's Strands Explained

If you are still a little confused about this difficult puzzle game, you can find an explanation in the section below. Find out what the theme, the Spangram, the clue, and all the words work together.

Want to play? Check out the New York Times Games Strands website available on almost any device with a browser.

item.title: New York Times Connections Hints and Answers for #394 July 9, 2024
item.description:
Connections is back with another challenging puzzle. If you are stuck on this one, just know you aren't alone; this puzzle is one of the more challenging that the New York Times Games has come up with.

In order to win this one today, you'll need to know the rules of Connections , you'll need to know about the categories, and you'll need to know all the words too. If you are stuck, you can find a handful of hints for the general puzzle, clues for the category, and more in the article below.

Words in the NYT Connections Puzzle #394 for July 9, 2024

The Connections puzzle for today contains the words: Scrub, Maze, Register, Shock, Hog, Log, Mop, Cheer, Tangle, Weed, Record, Fund, Friend, Mane, Trimmer, and Journal.

Hints for the NYT Connections Puzzle

In the sections below, you can find all sorts of different kinds of hints for this minimalist puzzle game. Each of the sections is covered up to keep from spoiling too much for yourself just by scrolling.

item.title: Final Fantasy 14: 9 Best New Characters In Dawntrail
item.description:
Highlights

  • The Dawntrail expansion introduces new characters and storylines in FF14 , with Wuk Evu and Zoraal Ja central to the plot.
  • Protagonist Wuk Lamat competes in a rite of succession to become Tural's ruler, facing challenges from her brother and others.
  • Queen Sphene and Gulool Ja Ja, the wise and legendary ruler of Tural, play significant roles in the expansion's story.

Final Fantasy 14's Dawntrail has released to much excitement from the community, as the expansion becomes the fifth to release since A Realm Reborn , marking a new start for Yoshi P and Square Enix. Dawntrail takes place in the exotic land of Tural, where players are thrust into a rite of succession contest between brothers that sees betrayal and bloodshed come to the forefront.

In the Warrior of Light and the Scions' newest adventure, a multitude of new characters are introduced who become highly influential and meaningful as the story devolves into utter chaos. Several of these characters either undergo dramatic transformations or add plenty of entertainment value to Dawntrail's MSQ.

9 Wuk Evu

A Goofy Handyman Who Is Always There To Aid Wuk Lamat

  • First Met : Kozama'uka

In FF14's Dawntrail , Wuk Evu is a character who offers a lot of comedic value, as the goofy handyman becomes a trusted ally of Wuk Lamat early into the rite of succession contest. Evu's nervy interactions with the Third Promise provide a lot of comedic relief, with Evu coming off as endearing and sweet through his behavior towards Lamat.

Even with his social awkwardness, Evu manages to give sage advice to Lamat throughout the contest, particularly in Yak T'el, where Evu teaches Lamat about the war between the Mamool Ja and the Xbrâ€™aal. Evu is always on hand to aid Lamat, helping the Third Promise progress in the contest and as a character.

8 Zoraal Ja

Militant Warrior Keen On Inflicting War

  • First Met : Tuliyollal

One character central to all the storylines in Dawntrail is the son of Gulool Ja Ja, Zoraal Ja , who, from the very start, harbors ambitions to inflict warfare on Tural and the rest of the world. When competing in the rite of succession, this character hits a stumbling block in Lamat, which causes him to lose the contest despite his raw strength as a warrior. In order to achieve his goals, Zoraal Ja reaches the Golden City, leading to his pact with Queen Sphene, which allows the Dawnservant's son to control a technologically advanced army hailing from Alexandria.

Despite his devastating actions that see Tuliyollal damaged and his father murdered, Zoraal Ja's plan to conquer is halted by Lamat, the Scions, and the Warrior of Light, leaving the king of Alexandria to perish with his son Gulool Ja right by his side.

7 Koana

Intelligent Scholar That Aims To Bring Advanced Technology To Tural

  • First Met : Tuliyollal

As the Second Promise of Tural, Koana sought to succeed his adoptive father, Gulool Ja Ja, as Tural's Dawnservant. The Miqo'te and Machinist foresaw his nation's future as heavily rooted in technology, which he hoped to bring from overseas, with Koana spending time studying in Old Sharlayan.

After advancing through the rite of succession competition, the headstrong Koana saw that the rightful successor to his father should be his sister, Lamat, and decided to back his sister's claim. When Lamat claims the title of Dawnservant, she makes Koana Dawnservant alongside her to fulfill the title of Vow of Reason. In the defense of Tuliyollal, Koana heroically leads the efforts as his sister heads to the dome to deal directly with their brother, Zoraal Ja.

6 Wuk Lamat

Protagonist That Seeks To Claim The Throne To Preserve Peace In Tural

  • First Met : Old Sharlayan

In Dawntrail , Lamat is the expansion's main protagonist, with players playing second fiddle to the exuberant and enthusiastic Hrothgar. The Warrior of Light and the Scions become involved in events in Tural when Lamat, the daughter of King Galool, competes in a rite of succession to take up the mantle of ruler, with the Third Promise recruiting Eorzea's heroes to aid her in saving Tural.

While being ever eager and emotional, Lamat goes through trials and tribulations that build her into a rightful and deserving monarch, becoming Tural's leader while also saving them from Zoraal Ja and Sphene's evil plots.

5 Otis Velona

A Loyal And Caring Knight Who Wishes To Protect Royalty

  • First Met : Heritage Found

When it comes to honor and valor, no character is more chivalrous than the knight Ser Otis Velona , who served Alexandria for several hundred years. Serving under Sphene in Alexandria's glory days, Otis continues his chivalry when he is introduced as Gulool Ja's protector, the son of the reigning king, Zoraal Ja.

Otis' appearance resembles a robot, with the character being used as a test subject in service of Sphene. Despite Otis saving Sphene, which leads to his demise, the character returns in Living Memory, where Otis's human form is shown to entertain endless children, reminiscent of his time spent with Gulool Ja.

4 Cahciua

Loving Mother Who Helps To End Sphene's Plan At The Cost Of Her Existence

  • First Met : Heritage Found

In Dawntrail , Cahciua is one of the many character additions that bring a sense of charm to the story, with the character's love for her son Erenville proving both comedic and sweet. Cahciua is introduced as a machine who leads the resistance group, Oblivion, which seeks to challenge Zoraal Ja's rule over their land. Despite her disquieting appearance to Erenville, Cahciua harbors a lot of joy and energy as she becomes involved in Lamat and the Scions' plans.

After reaching Living Memory, Cahciua's true form is shown, revealing that the character is an endless person, perishing years before Lamat and her company arrive in the dome. In her final moments before being shut down, Cahciua spends time with Erenville, as the pair share an emotional farewell before Sphene and her world are put to an end.

3 Bakool Ja Ja

Contender For The Throne Who Tries To Rectify His Mistakes

  • First Met : Tuliyollal

Bakool Ja Ja is a character with no morals or honor at the start of the Dawntrail MSQ, with the Mamool Ja seeking to become Dawnservant through chaos and corruption. As Bakool competes against Lamat, Koana, and Zoraal Ja in the rite of succession, Bakool sets up traps and tries to intimidate his opponents into submission throughout the competition, with the character even going as far as releasing Valigarmanda from its slumber.

After losing to Lamat in battle, Bakool begins to see the fault in his actions, with the chosen one going on to rectify his mistakes. From that point on, Bakool spearheads the campaign to end blessed sibling births, and comes to Tuliyollal's aid when Zoraal Ja and the Alexandrians strike, starting afresh as a comrade of Lamat.

2 Queen Sphene

A Kind Queen Whose Mission To Save Her People Led To Her Demise

  • First Met : Tuliyollal/Heritage Found

From the outset, Queen Sphene , the ruler of the Alexandrian empire, was a character of mystery and intrigue. On the surface, she was a kind and considerate monarch who put her citizens first, although this would lead to her eventual downfall. When the reflections of Alexandria and Tural submerge, Sphene acts friendly to Lamat and the Scions despite harboring plans to eliminate Tural to further sustain the lives of endless humans in Living Memory.

Despite dealing with Zoraal Ja's rule, Sphene almost achieves her goal before the Warrior of Light stops her. Even right up until her final moments, Sphene's love for her people endured, with the Queen's resolve proving unquestionable as she sought to save her kingdom.

1 Gulool Ja Ja

A Legendary And Wise Monarch Who Could Hold His Own In Combat

  • First Met : Tuliyollal

As the Dawnservant of Tural, Gulool Ja Ja reigns as a peaceful and heroic leader, with his past endeavors in his younger years leading his country to unite behind him. Gulool's unification of Tural, with the help of his comrades, saw the Dawnservant entrap the legendary fiend Valigarmanda, showcasing Gulool's fierce combat abilities.

Gulool's valor and strength in battle are further shown in his fights with Estinien, The Warrior of Light, and his son Zoraal Ja, whom the Dawnservant kills, but not before Zoraal revives himself using Alexandrian technology to slay his father. Despite his strength in battle, Gulool's most significant contribution were his words of wisdom, which aided many, with Lamat, Koana, and Krile all finding meaning in the Dawnservant's teachings.

item.title: 8 Worst Lot Traits in The Sims 4, Ranked
item.description:
There are a variety of lot traits and challenges available in The Sims 4 that can change a player's experience with the game. Depending on the chosen traits and challenges, a Sim can build certain skills quicker, experience interesting random events, or gain different moodlets. However, lot traits and challenges don't always have positive effects.

As the name suggests, challenges offer players the chance to create a more challenging Sims experience, but the lot traits associated with challenges are often pretty terrible. They can create negative moodlets, unpleasant surroundings, or even cause death if not dealt with. Here's what players need to know about them.

8 Quake Zone

Shake It Up

  • Game Pack: City Living
  • In-Game Description: "Occasionally there's a minor termor here. Probably nothing to worry about..."

Quake Zone is a challenge that can be applied to a lot, but it is also automatically applied to certain homes in the City Living game pack. Random earthquakes are pretty cool to see in The Sims 4 , as the whole screen will shake. However, it will apply a Scared or Tense moodlet to any Sims in the vicinity, while also breaking various household appliances.

It isn't the worst trait to have, and it does have some positives thanks to the cool earthquake effect. Still, it is an inconvenience for players trying to maintain positive moodlets for their Sims.

7 Volcanic Activity

A Stressful Vacation

  • Game Pack: Island Living
  • In-Game Description: "This lot is near an active volcano! Beware of earthquakes, steam vents, and occasional lava bombs."

This lot challenge is similar to the Quake Zone trait, but it goes much further than a simple tremor that will freak out a player's Sims. As well as eruptions that will randomly rattle, steam vents will rise from cracks in the ground and lava bombs will rain down from the sky. Lava bombs can destroy anything that you have placed outside, and if a Sim touches one before it cools down, they can die by fire. Sims will also get Tense moodlets when they feel the tremors from the volcanic activity.

There are positives to be had from Volcanic Activity, as Sims can collect the lava bombs once they have cooled down and make decorations out of them. However, the negative moodlets and the possibility of death and destruction make this a stressful lot trait.

6 Creepy Crawlies

Bugged Out

  • Game Pack: Jungle Adventure
  • In-Game Description: "It seems that some creepy pests have taken up residence here. Be prepared; when they hit you'll never see them coming!

This trait that randomly cause swarms of bees, bats, or spiders to descend upon the Sims in the lot. This can be dealt with if the Sim in question has repellent sprays in their inventory, as they will automatically defend themselves. This will lead to a positive moodlet too, which is always a good thing.

If a Sim doesn't have the necessary items, then they get negative moodlets instead, including moodlets that make them Tense or Uncomfortable. Creepy Crawlies is a nuisance of a lot challenge, not to mention one that might freak out players that aren't too fond of random bugs appearing in their home.

5 Grody

Vomit Inducing

  • Game Pack: City Living
  • In- Game Description: "Sims have a chance to get nauseous when eating, drinking, or using the bathroom."

This next lot trait will give any Sims on the lot a 33% chance of gaining the Nauseous moodlet when drinking, eating, or using the toilet. Even if the lot itself is as clean as a whistle, this trait will make nausea a common occurrence among the Sims in the area.

There's not much else to this trait, with no positives to be had. All players will get here are nauseous Sims, making it one of the worst traits a lot can have (unless there are players who are particularly fond of watching their Sims suffer with a bad stomach).

4 Gremlins

Chaotic Critters

  • Game Pack: City Living
  • In-Game Description: "Stuff breaks here a lot. It's like there are tiny goblins that come out at night and smash things...but that's ridiculous, right?"

With this challenge, items on the lot will break at midnight every night. Even if a Sim has a high Handiness skill, it can be incredibly frustrating to have to keep fixing all the broken plumbing and appliances that these naughty little monsters destroy.

This trait would at least be a little amusing if there was some kind of animation that showed the gremlins causing problems, but unfortunately, this isn't the case. It could be an interesting trait for players who want to put their handiness skills into practice or level them quickly. But otherwise, there isn't much to this challenge other than being a constant source of frustration.

3 Filthy

Ya Filthy Animal

  • Game Pack: City Living
  • In-Game Description: "From clogged sewers to grimy counters, this place seems to get dirty really quickly."

Having to clean in The Sims 4 can be annoying and time-consuming, just like in real life. Most of us play games to avoid doing those kinds of tasks, so why would we want to spend gaming time doing them too? The Filthy lot challenge makes cleaning ten times more irritating, as every cleanable item in the game will become dirty twice as quickly.

Players can hire maids or butlers to help them out, but it's going to cost hard-earned Simoleons. Sims will start to get negative moodlets when they are surrounded by too much dirt and grime, so it will be more difficult to keep them happy with this challenge. There's nothing positive to be had here, unless there are players out there who enjoy the cleaning aspect of The Sims 4 .

2 Mold

Moldy Mayhem

  • Game Pack: For Rent
  • In-Game Description: "There is a dampness in the air here that just doesn't feel right. Keep puddles mopped, trash from overflowing and plumbing objects clean or mold piles will start to appear, and beware of the deadly black mold pile!"

Mold narrowly beats out Filthy due to it being potentially deadly if left untreated. Two kinds of mold can appear if players don't regularly clean or take out the trash: Black Mold and Allergenic Mold. Allergenic Mold is green and has a speckled texture. It can cause Sims to become Dazed when exposed to it for too long, and they develop a condition called Sporeosis. When Sims are Dazed, they can't focus and are likely to fail when trying to complete tasks. Sporeosis can last a long time if the Allergenic Mold isn't dealt with.

Black Mold is where the deadly aspect of the Mold lot challenge comes in. If a Sim is exposed to too much Black Mold, they will start to grow mushrooms on their body and eventually die. But the Mold's effects don't end there. The deceased Sim can then become a Mold Ghost, spreading the mushrooms and spores from beyond the grave. Keeping Mold in check can be a stressful situation and can lead to multiple deaths, making it one of the worst lot challenges.

1 Cursed

Who Do You Voodoo

  • Game Pack: City Living
  • In-Game Description: "Lots of things seem to go wrong here."

Last but not least is the Cursed lot trait. With this challenge, everything that can go wrong is likely to go wrong. Sims have a chance to become voodoo'd when they are on a Cursed lot, meaning they will constantly have Tense and Uncomfortable moodlets that can last a lot longer than usual. Their needs will decay much faster, and they have a greater chance of dying from fire, exhaustion, or electrocution.

Not only does this lot trait make Sims miserable, but it's also guaranteed to make the player miserable as they struggle to keep their Sims from dying, be it from random fires or a decayed hunger meter. Only the bravest, or the cruelest, of players would be willing to inflict their lot with the Cursed challenge.

item.title: Nintendo Fan Makes Beautiful Switch Stand For Their Wife Based on an Animal Crossing Island
item.description:
Highlights

  • Gamer husband creates custom Animal Crossing-themed Nintendo Switch stand for his wife.
  • 3D printing technology empowers gamers to personalize their gaming experience.
  • Animal Crossing: New Horizons remains popular, with fans creating real-world items inspired by the game.

A gamer husband with a talent for miniature painting surprised his wife with a custom Animal Crossing -themed Nintendo Switch stand. Animal Crossing fans love making real-world creations based on their favorite game series, and this is a heartwarming example of what can be possible.

There have been Animal Crossing cookies and crochet dolls, and there is likely an endless stream of different creations that resourceful fans have made and shared online. It's no surprise that fans are pretty creative, as Animal Crossing by its very premise as a life simulation game encourages limitless creativity and imagination.

Redditor Metalgeargello shared the impressive 3D-printed stand, which is currently a work in progress, on r/AnimalCrossing. The design depicts a miniature island straight out of Animal Crossing: New Horizons , complete with a charming bridge and vibrantly colored trees. The stand showcases Metalgeargello's meticulous attention to detail, and he even went the extra mile to collect in-game color palettes to ensure the stand perfectly captures Animal Crossing 's whimsical aesthetic. He shares that his wife is really passionate about Animal Crossing , and he wanted to support her fandom and make her happy, even though he himself isn't much of a gamer.

An Example of Impressive 3D-Printed Gaming Creations

Metalgeargello's creation highlights the growing popularity of 3D printing within the gaming community. 3D printing technology allows gamers to create custom controllers, figurines, and even elaborate accessories like the Animal Crossing stand. With a little imagination and technical know-how, 3D printing empowers gamers to personalize their gaming experience and showcase their love for their favorite titles. Many gamers with 3D printing setups have already created a number of things based on their favorite titles, and as the tech gets more sophisticated and people get more skilled and creative, the world will continue to see more amazing gaming-related projects.

Animal Crossing: New Horizons , which was released all the way back in March 2020, quickly became a global phenomenon during the pandemic and still is a favorite. The next Animal Crossing game is rumored for a 2026 release to possibly be an early title for the anticipated Switch 2, and there doesn't seem to be any real rush to replace the current popular title, even though its last expansion DLC Happy Home Paradise came out nearly three years ago in November 2021. Animal Crossing: New Horizons players seem to still be happy designing and constructing their current islands, but they may also already be clamoring for something new, as well.
